page.title: 17The Gypsy Life-style
page.content: The gypsy caravans are either 22 or 24 feet long. Most are drawn by car or van. There are still a few horse-drawn carriages but these are mainly found in the south of England. The gypsies also bring horses, ponies, goats, dogs and hens to the site. Horses are tethered on land adjacent to the caravans. Gypsies traditionally obtained a living by fortune telling and horse dealing but more recently they prefer to deal in scrap metal. Most gypsies are very happy with their life-style but some, said the warden, are hard to please. There is still a strong tendency for gypsies to marry other gypsies. The warden admitted that he would prefer his son to marry a gypsy girl rather than someone who lives in a house.
